title: What are the similarities between classical school, Neo-classical school, and positivist school? - Quora

response.answer_text: of course - the classical school of criminology believed that crime is a choice and that punishment should fit the crime (think eye-for-an-eye or blood-for-blood). The neoclassics is similar except that they believe that aggravating and mitigating circumstances should be considered when considering punishment. The positivist school, set that biological traits determine criminality and crime is not a choice on the part of the wrongdoer (think ‘the devil made me do it’ or ‘it was my momma what made me like this!’).
